interjection: 1. Used alone to tell someone to sit down. English = 'Sit down!', 'Do be seated!' and so on.
verbLexeme: 1. To support the weight of your body by resting your buttocks on a chair or seat with the upper part of your body upright. English = sit, sit down; (be) seated.
nominalLexeme: 1. A object or a piece of furniture for people to sit on. English = seat, chair, stool.
2. A place in a theatre or cinema from where you watch the performance. English = seat.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: one thing placed on another.
